member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.SelectPictureDialog
member.summary: Defines attributes and behaviors of a custom dialog box for selecting pictures.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.SelectPictureDialog.ShowDialog
member.summary: Displays the "Select Picture" dialog box.
member.remarks: This is a modal dialog box.

example.para: This sample shows how to call and display the custom dialog box for selecting pictures. The resulting dialog will:

item.description: Filter out image files by displaying only .JPG and .BMP files.
Launch the dialog in the '\My Device\My Images' directory.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the SelectPictureDialog class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.SelectPictureDialog.FileName
member.summary: Gets the name of the selected picture file.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.SelectPictureDialog.Filter
member.summary: Gets or sets the file types displayed in the Select Picture dialog box.
member.value: A description of each filtering option, followed by the vertical Bar (|), followed by the filter pattern. Multiple filtering options are also separated by the vertical bar. For example, "Bitmap Files|*.BMP|JPG Files|*.JPG"
member.exception: Thrown when attempting to set an invalid filter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.SelectPictureDialog.FilterIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the currently selected filtering option.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.SelectPictureDialog.InitialDirectory
member.summary: Gets or sets the directory displayed in the Select Picture dialog box.
member.remarks: If null, a default directory is used.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.SelectPictureDialog.LockDirectory
member.summary: Not supported. Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user can browse to directories other than the InitialDirectory.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.SelectPictureDialog.ShowDrmContent
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether Digital Rights Management (DRM) protected files are displayed.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether Digital Rights Management (DRM) protected files that are protected such that they cannot be forwarded, are displayed.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user want to capture video with audio.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the user wants to use the default audio setting when capture video.

member.summary: Gets or sets the text of the incremental filter box.
member.remarks: The Incremental Filter box appears at the top of the Contact Chooser dialog box. The list of contacts in the dialog will be restricted to those matching this text.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.ChooseContactDialog.HideNew
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user can create a new Contact.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.ChooseContactDialog.ChooseContactOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user is limited to choosing just a Contact, or choosing a property of a specified Contact.
member.remarks: If true, the returned property is the first non-blank property in RequiredProperties. ChoosePropertyOnly and ChooseContactOnly cannot both be set to true. In the event that both are set to true, setting ChooseContactOnly to true will automatically set ChoosePropertyOnly to false

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.ChooseContactDialog.ChoosePropertyOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user is limited to choosing just a property of a specified Contact, or choosing the Contact.
member.remarks: If true, SelectedContact must be set before calling ShowDialog. ChoosePropertyOnly and ChooseContactOnly cannot both be set to true. In the event that both are set to true, setting ChoosePropertyOnly to true will automatically set ChooseContactOnly to false

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureMode
member.summary: The CameraCaptureMode enumeration specifies the camera mode used for image capture.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureMode.Still
member.summary: Capture a still image. This is the default. Value = 0.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureMode.VideoOnly
member.summary: Capture a video clip without audio.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureMode.VideoWithAudio
member.summary: Capture a video clip with audio.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureStillQuality
member.summary: The CameraCaptureStillQuality enumeration specifies the compression level used for still image capture.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureStillQuality.Default
member.summary: Capture a still image using the default compression level. This is the quality last selected by the user in Picture & Video > Camera Options > Still image compression level:. This is the default value. Value = 0.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureStillQuality.Low
member.summary: Capture a still image using the Low Quality compression level.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureStillQuality.Normal
member.summary: Capture a still image using the Normal Quality compression level.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureStillQuality.High
member.summary: Capture a still image using the High Quality compression level.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureVideoTypes
member.summary: The CameraCaptureVideoTypes enumeration defines the purpose of the video.
member.remarks:
Multimedia Messaging Service (MMS) applications must be able to capture video that meets criteria specific to multimedia messaging. To accommodate this, it is up to the mobile device Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) to register Video Profiles for each of the Video Types (All, Standard, and Messaging). To be compliant, you just need to create a object with a Video Type and video resolution that matches one of the Video Profiles.
Video Type specifies whether the video should be recorded in a format that is compatible with video messaging (usually encoded in either MPEG4 format or H.263 format), or for use in home videos and e-mail messaging (usually encoded in Windows Media Video (WMV) format).
Video Profiles are registry settings that contain a combination of Video Type, video encoder, video resolution, and a profile name.
When you ceate a object, the Video Type and video resolution that you specify are matched to a corresponding Video Profile to determine which Video Profile is used to initialize video capture mode. Your value is logically ANDed (&) with the VideoType value in each registered profile (e.g., "VideoType:DWORD = 0x0002" for messaging). Of those that produce a 1, the video resolutions are then compared. If a matching Video Profile is found, then it is used to initialize video capture mode. If one cannot be found, then an System.ArgumentException exception is raised. In this case, you should just create a object again, this time with a VideoTypes value of All (0xFFFF), and no specified video resolution; the first supported video resolution will then be used.
Note For more information on defining Video Profiles, see the section on Video Profiles in Camera, Pictures and Videos Registry Settings.
The following example demonstrates a typical video profile registration.
HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\Pictures\Camera\OEM\VideoProfile\1 ItemString:String = "MMS (174x144)" VideoType:DWORD = 0x0002 ; For messaging Width:DWORD = 176 Height:DWORD = 144
You can estimate the video file size that meets the time-limit restriction by specifying a particular video resolution.
Each Video Profile is listed as an option for the user in Pictures & Video > Menu > Quality.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureVideoTypes.All
member.summary: Only the resolution is used when matching video profiles. If resolution width and height both equal 0, and a CameraCaptureVideoTypes value of All is used, then the user's last selected resolution is used. Value = 0xFFFF.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureVideoTypes.Standard
member.summary: Produces high-quality video clips used for home movies and e-mail video messaging, using a video encoder such as the Windows Media encoder. For a CameraCaptureVideoTypes value of Standard, neither resolution width nor height can equal 0. Value = 1.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureVideoTypes.Messaging
member.summary: Produces video clips used for Multimedia Messaging Service (MMS) video messaging, which require a video encoder that conforms to the 3rd Generation Partnership Project (3GPP) specification. For a CameraCaptureVideoTypes value of Messaging, neither resolution width nor height can equal 0. Value = 2.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureDialog
member.summary: The CameraCaptureDialog class launches the Camera Capture dialog box, which allows the user to capture still images and video clips.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of CameraCaptureDialog class.

Thrown when the attempt to allocate the unmanaged buffer, fails.

member.summary: Allocates unmanaged buffer for the specified managed string.

member.summary: Call SHCameraCapture to launch camera capture dialog.
member.param: Struct parameter for unmanaged camera capture API.
member.exception: Thrown when the operation runs out of memory.
Thrown when an invalid argument is specified.
Thrown when an unknown error occurrs.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureDialog.ShowDialog
member.summary: Displays the "Camera Capture" dialog box, which allows the user to capture still images and video clips.
member.returns: One of the DialogResult values (either OK or Cancel).
member.exception: Thrown when operation ran out of memory.

Thrown when an invalid argument was specified. Note: There is only one valid video resolution on Smartphone. As a result, a value of CameraCapturevideoTypes.Messaging can produce an ArgumentException exception on Smartphone.
Thrown when an unknown error occurred.
member.remarks: This is a modal dialog box.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureDialog.Owner
member.summary: Gets or sets the control that owns the CameraCaptureDialog component.
member.value: A control object that owns this component.
member.remarks: The value of Owner can be NULL.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureDialog.FileName
member.summary: Gets the fully-qualified pathname of the image file or video file.
member.value: The fully-qualified pathname of the image file or video file.
member.remarks: If the ShowDialog method returns DialogResult.OK, then FileName is set to the fully-qualified pathname of the captured still image or video clip. Up to 260 characters can be returned.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureDialog.InitialDirectory
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the directory for storing the captured image or video file.
member.value: Specifies the name of the directory for storing the captured image or video file.
member.remarks: If NULL, the image or video file is stored in the directory specified in Picture & Video > Camera Options > Save files to:. If the directory does not exist, a System.ArgumentException exception is raised.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureDialog.DefaultFileName
member.summary: Gets or sets the still image or video image file name.
member.value: The file name used to store the captured still image or video image.
member.remarks: Still images on Windows Mobile devices conform to the JPEG standard. As a result, file names for still images must end in *.jpg. There is no restriction for naming video files, other than the file format must be supported by Windows Media Player Mobile. Since different video encoders can use differing naming conventions, it is important that the file name has the correct extension. To be safe, you can simply use NULL when naming Video files. If DefaultFileName is NULL, then the file name specified in Picture & Video > Camera Options > Type filename prefix: is used. If the file already exists, it is overwritten. The combination of InitialDirectory and DefaultFileName must not exceed 256 characters.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureDialog.Title
member.summary: Gets or sets the title of the Camera Capture dialog box.
member.value: The title of the Camera Capture dialog box.
member.remarks:
If NULL, a default title is displayed. The default title is "Camera".
On Smartphone, the first time the user enters the Camera View, the title bar displays the text specified with the CameraCaptureDialog.Title property.
On Pocket PC, the title bar should be the name of the calling application. However, the settings header text displays the text specified with the CameraCaptureDialog.Title property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureDialog.StillQuality
member.summary: Gets or sets the still image quality.
member.value: One of the CameraCaptureStillQuality enumeration values, which specifies the compression level used for still image capture. For more information, see .
member.remarks:
The default value is CameraCaptureStillQuality::Default, which is the quality last selected by the user in Picture & Video > Camera Options > Still image compression level:.
If the value is not defined in CameraCaptureStillQuality enumeration, System.ArgumentException is raised.
member.exception: Thrown when attempting to set an invalid camera capture still quality.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureDialog.VideoTypes
member.summary: Gets or sets the video type.
member.value: One of the CameraCaptureVideoTypes enumeration values, which specifies a video quality profile (i.e., whether the video clip is to be used by a Multimedia Messaging Service (MMS) application). For more information, see .
member.remarks:
The default value is CameraCaptureVideoTypes::All.
If the value is not defined in CameraCaptureVideoTypes enumeration, System.ArgumentException is raised.
member.exception: Thrown when attempting to set an invalid camera capture video type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureDialog.Resolution
member.summary: Gets or sets the image resolution.
member.value: The image resolution, as a (width, height) value pair, in pixels.
member.remarks: The default is (0, 0). For video clips, if either Width or Height is 0, only VideoTypes will be considered when selecting video profile (i.e., Resolution is ignored).

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureDialog.VideoTimeLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the time-limit for video clips.
member.value: The maximum length of time in seconds, allowed for a video clip.
member.remarks:
VideoTimeLimit is a time-interval represented by a TimeSpan object. For more information, see TimeSpan Structure on MSDN.
A time limit of 0 indicates that there is no limitation. The default is 0 (no limit).

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Forms.CameraCaptureDialog.Mode
member.summary: Gets or sets the image capture mode.
member.value: One of the CameraCaptureMode enumeration values, which specifies the camera mode used to initialize the Camera Capture function. For more information, see .
member.remarks: The default value is Still. If the value is not defined in the CameraCaptureMode enumeration, then a System.ArgumentException exception is raised.
member.exception: Thrown when attempting to set an invalid camera capture mode.
